summary: Email correspondence between Assistant U.S. Attorneys in the Southern District of New York discussing privilege review of materials from Epstein search warrants. The emails focus on identifying attorneys representing Epstein's estate and flagging communications involving private investigators for potential privilege claims.

persons.name: Marc Weinstein
persons.context: Identified as representing the co-executors of Epstein's estate along with Andrew Tomback.

connections.description: Both serve as co-executors of Jeffrey Epstein's estate.
Weinstein represents Indyke as co-executor of Epstein's estate.

events.title: Email exchange about Epstein search warrant review
events.description: Assistant U.S. Attorneys discuss privilege review of materials from Epstein search warrants, including communications with private investigators and estate attorneys.

locations: One Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: Epstein's estate co-executors are Darren Indyke and Richard Kahn, represented by attorneys Marc Weinstein and Andrew Tomback.
Epstein hired private investigators including Roy Black in connection with Florida criminal investigation and civil litigation.
Prosecutors flagged communications involving attorney Jack Goldberger for privilege review as he represented Epstein.
The document reveals ongoing government review of Epstein search warrant materials for privilege issues in October 2020.
The correspondence shows coordination between prosecutors and estate attorneys regarding privilege claims over investigative materials.
